French foreign minister arrives in Kyiv for show of support
subhead: Foreign Minister Jean-Noël Barrot went to Ukraine on a suprise visit, blasting the latest wave of Russian attacks: 'This inhumane, cynical and cruel violence has no military purpose. Its sole aim is to terrorize civilians in a failed attempt to undermine Ukrainian morale.'

title: What comes next for French anti-pesticide petition signed by over a million?
subhead: After a lobby-backed law that would reintroduce a banned pesticide was speedily adopted in the Assemblée Nationale, the petition puts pressure on lawmakers to hold a debate on its contents. But a repeal appears unlikely.
byline: By Mathilde Gérard and Robin Richardot

title: Trump administration releases FBI records on MLK Jr. despite his family’s opposition
subhead: The release involves more than 240,000 pages of records that had been under a court-imposed seal since 1977. King's family urged that 'these files must be viewed within their full historical context.'

title: How immigration raids are reshaping Los Angeles
subhead: In a city where much of the economy relies on immigrant labor, fear and absenteeism have paralyzed entire sectors of the local economy. Although the Trump administration began to withdraw 2,000 of the 4,000 National Guard members deployed in Los Angeles, the economic consequences have been visible since their arrival on June 8.
byline: By Julie Leopo and Allison Ferrera

In Toulon, a dive into modernism
subhead: 'Aquatic Monuments' (1/6). Throughout the summer, Le Monde brings you to public French pools with exceptional architecture. In Toulon, the Port-Marchand aquatic stadium, built entirely from concrete, glazed tiles and murals, displays a style that is both sleek and colorful.

title: Conor the parrot, a somber allegory for Ukraine's trauma
subhead: After the death of his owner, Anton, Conor withered and appeared to lose the will to live. Tatiana, the widow, could no longer bear to hear him speak in 'the same intonations' as Anton.
byline: By Ariane Chemin (Dnipro, Lviv, (Ukraine), special correspondent)

title: How the Russian and Ukrainian front lines are shifting
subhead: Since Russia invaded Ukraine in February 2022, the front lines have constantly evolved. These changes have been geographical, with advances, withdrawals and stabilization of areas, as well as morphological and technological.
